statement_context: an event in Port Washington, N.Y.
ruling_headline: A look at Hillary Clinton's claim about Vermont's gun pipeline to New York
statement: "The state that has the highest per capita number of … guns that end up committing crimes in New York come from Vermont."

ruling_headline: Sanders: U.S. multinationals would owe $620 billion on overseas profits
statement: "The largest U.S. companies would owe $620 billion in U.S. taxes on the cash they store in tax havens."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Clinton voted for 'virtually every' trade agreement, killing millions of jobs, Sanders says
statement: Says Hillary Clinton voted "for virtually every trade agreement that has cost the workers of this country millions of jobs."

ruling_headline: Did Hillary Clinton say Bernie Sanders 'not qualified' to be president? Not directly
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "has been saying lately that she thinks that I am, 'not qualified to be president.' "

statement_context: an interview with CNN's Jake Tapper
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders has released few tax returns compared with past and present candidates
statement: Says his campaign has released his past tax returns.

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says Wall Street tax would pay for his free tuition plan
statement: Says his free public university tuition program "is paid for … by a tax on Wall Street's speculation."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders was the roll call amendment king from 1995 to 2007
statement: "Bernie Sanders passed more roll call amendments in a Republican Congress than any other member."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Miami
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Bernie Sanders supported Minutemen, indefinite detention for the undocumented
statement: In 2006, Bernie Sanders "voted in the House with hard-line Republicans for indefinite detention for undocumented immigrants, and then he sided with those Republicans to stand with vigilantes known as Minutemen who were taking up outposts along the border to hunt down immigrants."

statement_context: in the Democratic debate in Florida
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton wrongly says Bernie Sanders wants to delay the Clean Power Plan
statement: "The Clean Power Plan is something that Sen. Sanders has said he would delay implementing."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Miami
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders' statistic on black, Hispanic unemployment has merit, but may be out of date
statement: "If you look at Latino kids between 17 and 20 who graduated high school, 36 percent of them are unemployed or underemployed. … African-American kids are unemployed or underemployed to the tune of 51 percent."

statement_context: the Democratic debate at Miami Dade College
ruling_headline: Sanders said Clinton backed return for undocumented kids
statement: When Honduran children came into this country, "Secretary Clinton said send them back."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Flint, Mich.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says he consistently beats Donald Trump by bigger margins than Hillary Clinton does
statement: "Almost every poll has shown that Sanders vs. Trump does a lot better than Clinton vs. Trump … and, that’s true nationally."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Flint, Mich.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says he consistently beats Donald Trump by bigger margins than Hillary Clinton does
statement: "Almost every poll has shown that Sanders vs. Trump does a lot better than Clinton vs. Trump … and, that’s true nationally."

statement_context: a Democratic debate in Flint, Mich.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders has a point: Water in Flint much more expensive than in Burlington
statement: "(Flint, Mich., is) paying three times more for poison water than I am paying in Burlington, Vt., for clean water."

statement_context: a Democratic debate in Flint, Mich.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders wrong to say, 'When you're white ... you don't know what it's like to be poor'
statement: "When you're white ... you don't know what it's like to be poor."

statement_context: the Democratic debate in Flint, Mich.
ruling_headline: Sanders overshoots on NAFTA job losses
statement: "NAFTA, supported by the Secretary (Clinton), cost us 800,000 jobs nationwide."

ruling_headline: Sanders: Welfare reform more than doubled 'extreme poverty'
statement: "Since (welfare reform) was signed into law, the number of families living in extreme poverty has more than doubled."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders, Chuck Todd debate crime bill vote, assault weapons ban
statement: Says he supported the 1994 crime bill because "there is a ban on assault weapons in that bill."

statement_context: comments during the PBS Democratic debate
ruling_headline: Reports' limitations plague Bernie Sanders' claim about high childhood poverty rates in the U.S.
statement: The United States has "the highest rate of childhood poverty of almost any major country on Earth."

statement_context: comments during the PBS Democratic debate
ruling_headline: Sanders: African-Americans lost half their wealth because of Wall Street collapse
statement: "The African-American community lost half of their wealth as a result of the Wall Street collapse."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders has the correct diagnosis: U.S. prescription drug prices typically highest in world
statement: "In America, we pay, by far, the highest prices in the world for prescription drugs."

statement_context: a Democratic debate in New Hampshire
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders offers overheated claim on where all Republicans stand on climate change
statement: "Not one Republican has the guts to recognize that climate change is real."

ruling_headline: In foreign policy spat, Bernie Sanders suggests Madeleine Albright supported Iraq invasion
statement: "Tell me what Madeleine Albright’s position was on the War on Iraq. I wouldn’t be surprised if she supported it."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Bernie Sanders doesn't have a foreign policy adviser network
statement: "There really isn’t any kind of foreign policy network that is supporting and advising Sen. Sanders."

statement_context: the Democratic debate in Durham, N.H.
ruling_headline: Clinton says Sanders proposed Iranian troops in Syria
statement: Says Bernie Sanders advocated putting "Iranian troops into Syria to try and resolve the conflict there. Putting them right on the doorstep of Israel."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Durham, N.H.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders mistaken about whether his campaign's ad had cited a nonexistent endorsement
statement: Says a Sanders campaign ad "never said ... a newspaper endorsed us that did not."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders exaggerates concentration of wealth, income for top 1 percent
statement: Americans "are working longer hours for low wages . . . and yet almost all new income and wealth is going to the top 1 percent."

ruling_headline: Mixed bag for Bernie Sanders' claim about wages, hours, income growth
statement: "While our people work longer hours for lower wages, almost all new income goes to the top 1 percent."

ruling_headline: What Bernie Sanders, Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton have said about reparations for slavery
statement: Says his views on reparations for slavery are the same as Barack Obama's and Hillary Clinton's.

statement_context: a town hall meeting in Underwood, Iowa.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says he polls better against GOP candidates than Hillary Clinton
statement: "Almost all of the polls that have come out suggest that I am a much stronger candidate against the Republicans than is Hillary Clinton."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: What Donald Trump said about the Chinese inventing the 'hoax' of climate change
statement: Says Donald Trump "thinks that climate change is a hoax, invented by the Chinese."

statement_context: a town hall in Underwood, Iowa
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders’ NRA report card: D-minus is most recent grade
statement: "I have a D-minus voting record from the NRA."

statement_context: comments during the South Carolina Democratic presidential debate
ruling_headline: Less than 10 percent of defense budget is for fighting terrorism, Sanders says
statement: "Very little of (the defense) budget — less than 10 percent — actually goes into fighting ISIS and international terrorism."

statement_context: comments during the South Carolina Democratic presidential debate
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders exaggerates with claim that he helped write Obamacare
statement: "I helped write" the Affordable Care Act.

statement_context: comments during the South Carolina Democratic presidential debate
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton correct that Bernie Sanders flip-flopped on liability for gun makers, sellers
statement: Says Bernie Sanders "has reversed his position on immunity" for gun manufacturers and sellers.

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Sanders: Obama was right, Clinton was wrong on Iran
statement: Says Hillary Clinton called Barack Obama "naive" for saying he was would "sit down and talk to the Iranians" during the 2008 Democratic primary.

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press".
ruling_headline: Sanders spins the facts when he says campaign did not 'go out and take' Clinton data
statement: "We didn't go out and take" information from the Hillary Clinton campaign.

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Sanders' claim that U.S. spends 3 times per capita what the U.K. spends on health care
statement: The United States spends "almost three times per capita what they spend in the U.K." on health care and "50 percent more than they pay in France."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders is right: Saudi Arabia is more focused on the conflict in Yemen than fighting ISIS
statement: "Instead of fighting ISIS, (the Saudis) have focused more on a campaign to oust Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: Fact-checking Bernie Sanders' comments on climate change and terrorism
statement: Climate change is "directly related" to the growth of terrorism.

ruling_headline: Sanders: 'Significantly less than 10%' of defense dollars go to fight terrorism
statement: Out of the total U.S. military budget, "significantly less than 10 percent of that money is used to fight international terrorism."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Des Moines, Iowa
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says U.S. is only major country that doesn't guarantee health care as a right
statement: The United States is "the only major country on earth that doesn't guarantee health care to all people as a right, not a privilege."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Des Moines, Iowa
ruling_headline: Income tax rates were 90 percent under Eisenhower, Sanders says
statement: Says income tax rates under Eisenhower were as high as 90 percent.

statement_context: a Democratic presidential candidates' forum in Rock Hill, S.C.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says over half of black workers earn less than $15 an hour
statement: "Over half of the black workers in this country earn less" than $15 an hour.

statement_context: the First in the South Democratic Presidential forum.
ruling_headline: Fact-checking Martin O'Malley's claim that Bernie Sanders sought primary challenger to Obama
statement: "When President Obama was running for re-election … Senator Sanders was trying to find someone to primary him."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Boulder, Colo.
ruling_headline: Chris Christie says Bernie Sanders’s plan is 'to raise your taxes to 90 percent'
statement: Bernie Sanders’s plan is "to raise your taxes to 90 percent."

statement_context: a graphic circulating on the Internet
ruling_headline: Internet graphic says Bernie Sanders slammed antidepressants, but quote is actually the Unabomber's
statement: Says Bernie Sanders once said, "Instead of removing the conditions that make people depressed, modern society gives them antidepressant drugs."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Las Vegas
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says people are getting prison sentences for smoking marijuana
statement: "We are imprisoning or giving jail sentences to young people who are smoking marijuana."

statement_context: the CNN Democratic presidential debate in Las Vegas
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says 'every other major country' has family paid leave except United States
statement: "Every other major country" has family paid leave.

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders: The United States has 'more people in jail than any other country on Earth'
statement: "Today in America, we have more people in jail than any other country on Earth."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Las Vegas
ruling_headline: In debate, Bernie Sanders says African-American youth unemployment is 51%, and 36% for Hispanics
statement: "African-American youth unemployment is 51 percent. Hispanic youth unemployment is 36 percent."

ruling_headline: Is Bernie Sanders the only presidential candidate without a super PAC?
statement: "Unlike virtually every other campaign, we don't have a super PAC."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says federal government, not McDonald's or Walmart, is biggest low-wage employer
statement: The largest low-wage employer "is not McDonalds or Walmart but the U.S. government."

statement_context: a shareable graphic on the Web
ruling_headline: Web graphic says Bernie Sanders doesn't support compulsory K-12 education
statement: Says Bernie Sanders opposes "requiring all children to have a K-12 education."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders: 'Saudi Arabia has the third-largest military budget in the entire world'
statement: "Saudi Arabia has the third-largest military budget in the entire world."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders repeats flawed claim about U.S. health care spending compared to other countries
statement: "We spend almost twice as much per capita on health care as do the people of any other country."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says 'real unemployment' rate for African American youth is 51 percent
statement: For African-Americans between the ages of 17 and 20, "the real unemployment rate … is 51 percent."

ruling_headline: Did Bernie Sanders vote against background checks and waiting periods for gun purchases?
statement: "Bernie Sanders voted against the Brady Bill -- background checks and waiting periods."

ruling_headline: Sanders: Child poverty is higher in America than any other major country
statement: "We have the highest rate of childhood poverty of any major country on Earth."

ruling_headline: Meme says Hillary Clinton's top donors are banks and corporations, Bernie Sanders' are labor unions
statement: Says Hillary Clinton’s top 10 donors are mainly "banks, corporations and media," while Bernie Sanders’ top 10 donors are labor unions.

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders: U.S. 'only major country' that doesn't guarantee right to health care
statement: "We are the only major country on Earth that doesn't guarantee health care to all people as a right."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says income inequality is widest since the 1920s
statement: "The gap between the very rich and everyone else in America is wider today than at any time since the 1920s."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says a black male baby born today has 1-in-3 chance of prison
statement: "A black male baby born today, if we do not change the system, stands a one-in-three chance (of) ending up in jail."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says 99 percent of 'new' income is going to top 1 percent
statement: "99 percent of all new income today (is) going to the top 1 percent."

statement_context: a town hall in Austin, Texas
ruling_headline: Checking Bernie Sanders on Americans' low voter-turnout rates
statement: "In this last election in November, ... 63 percent of the American people chose not to vote, ... 80 percent of young people, (and) 75 percent of low-income workers chose not to vote."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders: GOP budget does not ask ultra-wealthy to contribute 'one penny' to deficit reduction
statement: "From 2013-2015, the richest 14 Americans increased their net wealth by more than $157 billion, yet the Republican budget would not require these Americans to contribute one penny to deficit reduction."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says U.S. was 1st in college degrees in 1990, but now ranks 12th in world
statement: "In 1990, the U.S. led the world in the percentage of 25-34 year olds with college degrees. Today we are in 12th place."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says tax share paid by corporations has fallen from 33% to 9% since 1952
statement: "In 1952, the corporate income tax accounted for 33 percent of all federal tax revenue. Today, despite record-breaking profits, corporate taxes bring in less than 9 percent."

ruling_headline: Sen. Bernie Sanders says Texas Republicans want to abolish Social Security, V.A. health care
statement: "(Texas Republicans) believe in abolishing Social Security, abolishing V.A. health care."

ruling_headline: Sanders: One out of four corporations pay no taxes
statement: "One out of four corporations doesn't pay a nickel in (federal income) taxes."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says six of 10 Americans say wealth should be distributed more equally
statement: "Nearly 6 out of 10 believe that money and wealth should be more evenly distributed among a larger percentage of the people in the U.S."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says poverty in U.S. is at an all-time high
statement: "Poverty levels (are) at an all-time high."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says Walmart heirs own more wealth than bottom 40 percent of Americans
statement: "Today the Walton family of Walmart own more wealth than the bottom 40 percent of America."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says six bank companies have assets equaling 60 percent of U.S. GDP
statement: "Today, you have six financial institutions, the largest six, that have assets that are the equivalent of 60 percent of the GDP of the United States of America."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says 12 million have slipped from middle class into poverty since 2000
statement: "Since 2000, nearly 12 million Americans have slipped out of the middle class and into poverty."

ruling_headline: Sen. Bernie Sanders says Americans now work the longest hours of any people around the world
statement: "We now work the longest hours of any people around the world."

ruling_headline: Sen. Bernie Sanders says 99.7% of American families would be exempt from estate tax
statement: Under the compromise tax agreement, "99.7% of American families will not pay 1 nickel in an estate tax."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says ExxonMobil paid no taxes in 2009, but that's inaccurate
statement: "Last year, ExxonMobil made $19 billion in profit. Guess what. They paid zero in taxes. They got a $156 million refund from the IRS."

ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders, in viral speech, says top 1 percent earn more than 23 percent of U.S. income
statement: In 2007, "the top 1 percent of all income earners in the United States made 23.5 percent of all income," which is "more than the entire bottom 50 percent."

statement_context: an appearance on the Rachel Maddow Show
ruling_headline: Sanders says U.S. doubles every other country in per capita health spending
statement: "We spend twice as much per capita on health care as any other nation on Earth."
